Count codes by preferred coder and transcript

Source: R/count_codes.R
count_codes.Rd

Summarizes binary c_* code columns after restricting each transcript to a single preferred coder. Returns per-code totals across excerpts and, per code, the number and proportion of transcripts in which the code appears at least once.

Usage

count_codes(
  excerpts,
  preferred_coders,
  output_type = c("tibble", "kable", "datatable"),
  include_zero = FALSE
)

Arguments

excerpts

A data frame containing at least media_title, excerpt_creator, and one or more numeric/binary columns whose names start with "c_" (0/1 recommended).

preferred_coders

Character vector of coder names, ordered from most- to least-preferred. Used to select which coder's excerpts are retained per transcript (media_title).

output_type

One of "tibble", "kable", or "datatable"; controls the return type. Default is "tibble".

include_zero

Logical; if TRUE, keep codes with zero total applications. Default FALSE.

Value

If output_type = "tibble", a tibble with columns:

  • Code: the code variable name (a c_* column).

  • total_preferred_coder: total number of applications (sum of 1s).

  • transcript_count: number of transcripts with at least one 1.

  • transcript_proportion: proportion of transcripts with at least one 1 (0–1, rounded to 2 decimals).

If "kable", a knitr_kable object; if "datatable", a DT::datatable widget.

Details

For each transcript (media_title), the function keeps all excerpts from the most-preferred coder present in preferred_coders and drops rows by other coders. It then:

  1. Computes total_preferred_coder: the sum of 1s for each code across the retained excerpts.

  2. Computes transcript_count: the number of distinct transcripts in which a code appears at least once, and transcript_proportion: that count divided by the number of transcripts retained after filtering.

Uses dplyr's .by argument (requires dplyr >= 1.1.0). If you need compatibility with older dplyr versions, replace that step with an explicit group_by(media_title) + filter().

Examples

set.seed(1)
toy <- data.frame(
  media_title     = rep(paste0("T", 1:3), each = 4),
  excerpt_creator = rep(c("Ann","Bob","Ann","Cara"), 3),
  c_help          = rbinom(12, 1, .4),
  c_harm          = rbinom(12, 1, .2),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)
# Prefer Ann over Bob over Cara
count_codes(toy, preferred_coders = c("Ann","Bob","Cara"))
#> # A tibble: 2 × 4
#>   Code   total_preferred_coder transcript_count transcript_proportion
#>   <chr>                  <int>            <int>                 <dbl>
#> 1 c_help                     2                2                  0.67
#> 2 c_harm                     1                1                  0.33

# Keep zero-count codes
count_codes(toy, c("Ann","Bob","Cara"), include_zero = TRUE)
#> # A tibble: 2 × 4
#>   Code   total_preferred_coder transcript_count transcript_proportion
#>   <chr>                  <int>            <int>                 <dbl>
#> 1 c_help                     2                2                  0.67
#> 2 c_harm                     1                1                  0.33

# Return a knitr::kable table
count_codes(toy, c("Ann","Bob","Cara"), output_type = "kable")
#> 
#> 
#> Table: Code Counts (Preferred Coders Only)
#> 
#> |Code   | total_preferred_coder| transcript_count| transcript_proportion|
#> |:------|---------------------:|----------------:|---------------------:|
#> |c_help |                     2|                2|                  0.67|
#> |c_harm |                     1|                1|                  0.33|
